text:
Most brokerage houses have adopted a wait and watch on the ONGC Ltd and Hindustan Petroleum Ltd. deal.India’s largest oil explorer will buy government’s 51.1 percent stake in HPCL valued at about Rs 29,900 crore, based on Wednesday’s closing stock price.The move was inline with the government’s plan to create an Indian oil giant through consolidation and mergers, to help it complete with international rivals and help weather crude-price volatility.






Need More Clarity, Says JPMorganJPMorgan said HPCL shareholders are likely to be disappointed since the government said there will be no open offer, while it expects a relief rally in ONGC.The brokerage house said valuation of the stake still needs to be finalised and a large premium (for the HPCL stake) would be negative for ONGC though clarity would take time.








The key question is how would the HPCL stake be financed? 






JPMorgan said there are three options for ONGC to finance this potential stake sale.Share swap (unlikely)Market borrowing (could easily be done)Monetization of existing equity investments






RatingHPCL: Maintained 'Underweight' rating on the stock with price target at Rs 300ONGC: Maintained 'Neutral' rating with price target at Rs 185
title: HPCL-ONGC Deal: Brokerages Maintain Status Quo Awaiting More Clarity
